intro: Borbonia ericifolia, commonly known as the shrub heath, is a small evergreen shrub native to the island of Madagascar. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. The plant has small, leathery leaves that are usually covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually pink or red, and it produces small, dark berries as fruit. Borbonia ericifolia plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various local wildlife species.
